info.title: Rollout API reference
info.description:
Service name

 API Objects are: Rollout

parameters.name: O.name
parameters.description:
Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumeric or ._- characters
minimum length is 2 and maximum length is 64 characters. must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, .length of string should be between 2 and 64

parameters.name: O.tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant to which the object belongs to. This can be automatically filled in many cases based on
the tenant the user, who created the object, belongs to.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain only alphanumerics.
Minimum length is 1 and maximum length is 48 characters. must be alpha-numericslength of string should be between 1 and 48

parameters.name: O.namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumeric or ._- characters
maximum length is 64 characters. must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, .length of string should be between 2 and 64

parameters.name: O.generation-id
parameters.description:
GenerationID is the generation Id for the object. This is incremented anytime there
 is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.resource-version
parameters.description:
Resource version in the object store. This is updated anytime there is any change to the object.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.uuid
parameters.description:
UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This is generated on creation of the object.
System generated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.creation-time
parameters.description:
CreationTime is the creation time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.mod-time
parameters.description:
ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link for accessing this object. When the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Example:
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" 
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: label-selector
parameters.description: LabelSelector to select on labels in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-selector
parameters.description: FieldSelector to select on field values in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-change-selector
parameters.description: FieldChangeSelector specifies to generate a watch notification on change in field(s) specified.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

parameters.name: sort-order
parameters.description: order to sort List results in.

parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server.

the tenant the user, who created the object, belongs to.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain only alphanumerics.
Minimum length is 1 and maximum length is 48 characters. must be alpha-numericslength of string should be between 1 and 48

parameters.name: spec.version
parameters.description: New Version of the image to rollout to.

parameters.name: spec.scheduled-start-time
parameters.description: Time, if specified, at which the rollout is supposed to start.

parameters.name: spec.scheduled-end-time
parameters.description:
ScheduledEndTime, if specified, after which the rollout is supposed to stop, if not completed by that time
Typically represents the end of Maintenance window.

parameters.name: spec.max-parallel
parameters.description:
MaxParallel is the maximum number of nodes getting updated at any time
This setting is applicable only to DistributedServiceCards.
Controller nodes are always upgraded one after another.

parameters.name: spec.max-nic-failures-before-abort
parameters.description:
After these many failures are observed during NIC upgrade, the rollout process stops
This setting applies to smartNICs only.
The controller nodes are rollout first and any failure there stops the rollout of DistributedServiceCards.

parameters.name: spec.suspend
parameters.description:
When Set to true, the current rollout is suspended. Existing Nodes/Services/DistributedServiceCards in the middle of rollout continue
 rollout execution but any Nodes/Services/DistributedServiceCards which has not started Rollout will not be scheduled one.

parameters.name: spec.dscs-only
parameters.description: Dont upgrade Controller but only upgrade DistributedServiceCards.

parameters.name: spec.dsc-must-match-constraint
parameters.description: When DSCMustMatchConstraint is true, Any smartNIC which does not match OrderConstraints does not go through rollout.

parameters.name: spec.retry
parameters.description: If enabled, will retry rollout of failed naples within the maintenance window upto a max of 5 times.

parameters.name: status.completion-percent
parameters.description: Heuristic value of percentage completion of the rollout.

parameters.name: status.start-time
parameters.description: Start time of Rollout.

parameters.name: status.end-time
parameters.description: End time of Rollout.

parameters.name: status.prev-version
parameters.description: Version of the cluster before the start of rollout.

parameters.name: status.reason
parameters.description: details the reason for overall Failure or Suspend.

get.summary: Watch Rollout objects. Supports WebSockets or HTTP long poll

apiObjectMeta.description: ObjectMeta contains metadata that all objects stored in kvstore must have.

labels.description: Labels are arbitrary (key,value) pairs associated with any object.

apiObjectMetaUpdate.description: ObjectMeta contains metadata that all objects stored in kvstore must have.

namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

name.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

uri.description: URI is a link to accessing the referenced object.

apiObjectRef.description: ObjectRef contains identifying information about an object.

result.description: Result contains the status of the operation, success or failure.

message.description: Message contains human readable form of the error.

code.description: Code is the HTTP status code.

object-ref.description: Reference to the object (optional) for which this status is being sent.

apiStatus.description: Status is returned for calls that dont return objects.

apiStatusResult.description: StatusResult contains possible statuses for a NIC.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

api-version.title: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server

apiTypeMeta.description: TypeMeta contains the metadata about kind and version for all API objects.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name whose content describes the type of the
serialized protocol buffer message.

For URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, the
following restrictions and interpretations apply:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully
  qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`).
  The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is
  not accepted).
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

key.description: The label key that the condition applies to.

values.description:
Values contains one or more values corresponding to the label key. "equals" and
"notEquals" operators need a single Value. "in" and "notIn" operators can have
one or more values.

labelsRequirement.description: Requirement defines a single matching condition for a selector.

labelsSelector.description:
Selector is used to select objects by labels. Requirements in the selector are ANDed.
A selector with no Requirements does not select anything.

rolloutAutoMsgRolloutActionWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgRolloutActionWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for RolloutAction objects

rolloutAutoMsgRolloutWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgRolloutWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Rollout objects

rolloutRollout.title:
Rollout object captures the admin's intent and status of the software version running on the cluster
 It is incorrect to have two different Rollouts active at the same time

rolloutRolloutAction.title:
RolloutAction object acts as a lock to make sure only one outstanding rollout
is in progress in the cluster

rolloutRolloutActionList.title: RolloutActionList is a container object for list of RolloutAction objects

completion-percent.title: Heuristic value of percentage completion of the rollout

prev-version.title: Version of the cluster before the start of rollout

rolloutRolloutActionStatus.title:
RolloutAction Status gives the status of the rollout at the top level as well as details of
 individual components

rolloutRolloutCreate.title:
Rollout object captures the admin's intent and status of the software version running on the cluster
 It is incorrect to have two different Rollouts active at the same time

rolloutRolloutList.title: RolloutList is a container object for list of Rollout objects

name.title: Name of the Node, Service or DistributedServiceCard

phase.title: Phase indicates a certain rollout phase/condition

start-time.description:
The time of starting the rollout for this node/service. 
This does not include the pre-check which can happen way before the actual rollout.

end-time.title: Time at which rollout completed for this node/service

reason.title: The reason for the Phase last transition, if any

message.description: A detailed message indicating details about the transition.

rolloutRolloutPhase.title: RolloutPhase gives details of status of Rollout on each Node/Service/DistributedServiceCard

version.title: New Version of the image to rollout to

scheduled-start-time.title: Time, if specified, at which the rollout is supposed to start

scheduled-end-time.title:
ScheduledEndTime, if specified, after which the rollout is supposed to stop, if not completed by that time
Typically represents the end of Maintenance window

max-parallel.description:
MaxParallel is the maximum number of nodes getting updated at any time
This setting is applicable only to DistributedServiceCards.
Controller nodes are always upgraded one after another.

max-nic-failures-before-abort.title:
After these many failures are observed during NIC upgrade, the rollout process stops
This setting applies to smartNICs only.
The controller nodes are rollout first and any failure there stops the rollout of DistributedServiceCards

order-constraints.title:
If specified, this is the sequence in which the DistributedServiceCards are upgraded based on their labels.
if a DistributedServiceCard matches multiple constraints, the first one is used.
 Any DistributedServiceCard which does not match the constraints is upgraded at the end.
This order is mainly for the smartNICs on Hosts
Controller nodes are always rollout one after other

suspend.description:
When Set to true, the current rollout is suspended. Existing Nodes/Services/DistributedServiceCards in the middle of rollout continue
 rollout execution but any Nodes/Services/DistributedServiceCards which has not started Rollout will not be scheduled one.

dscs-only.title: Dont upgrade Controller but only upgrade DistributedServiceCards

dsc-must-match-constraint.title: When DSCMustMatchConstraint is true, Any smartNIC which does not match OrderConstraints does not go through rollout

retry.title: If enabled, will retry rollout of failed naples within the maintenance window upto a max of 5 times

rolloutRolloutSpec.title: RolloutSpec is the Spec of a Rollout

controller-services-status.title: Rollout status of Various Controller Services

dscs-status.description:
Rollout status of DistributedServiceCards in the cluster. Has entries for DistributedServiceCards on Controller nodes as well as workload nodes
The entries are group by parallelism based on the order-constraints and max-parallel specified by the user.

completion-percent.title: Heuristic value of percentage completion of the rollout

prev-version.title: Version of the cluster before the start of rollout

reason.title: details the reason for overall Failure or Suspend

rolloutRolloutStatus.title:
Rollout Status gives the status of the rollout at the top level as well as details of
 individual components
